fields.name: commutative
fields.definition: $xy=yx$ for all $x$ and $y$ in the ring

fields.name: division ring
fields.definition: all nonzero elements are units

fields.name: simple
fields.definition: Only ideals are the two trivial ideals

fields.name: simple Artinian
fields.definition: $R$ is simple and Artinian

fields.name: semisimple
fields.definition: semiprimitive and Artinian

fields.name: semiprimitive
fields.definition: Jacobson radical zero

fields.name: Baer
fields.definition: For any subset $X$ of $R$, the right annihilator of $X$ is a summand of $R$

fields.name: domain
fields.definition: No nonzero zero divisors

fields.name: prime
fields.definition: The product of nonzero right ideals is nonzero

fields.name: reduced
fields.definition: No nonzero nilpotent elements

fields.name: semiprime
fields.definition: No nonzero nilpotent right ideals

fields.name: strongly regular
fields.definition: von Neumann regular and reduced

fields.name: unit regular
fields.definition: For every $x$, there exists a unit $u$ such that $x=xux$

fields.name: von Neumann regular
fields.definition: For every x, there exists y such that x=xyx

fields.name: semi free ideal ring
fields.definition: All finitely generate right ideals are free and of unique rank

fields.name: fully semiprime
fields.definition: all proper ideals are semiprime

fields.name: fully prime
fields.definition: all proper ideals are prime

fields.name: Frobenius
fields.definition: $R$ is quasi-Frobenius and the right socle is isomorphic to $R/J(R)$

fields.name: quasi-Frobenius
fields.definition: Noetherian and self-injective

fields.name: semiprimary
fields.definition: $R$ is semilocal and $J(R)$ is nilpotent

fields.name: nilpotent radical
fields.definition: Has nilpotent Jacobson radical

fields.name: nil radical
fields.definition: Has nil Jacobson radical

fields.name: local
fields.definition: $R/J(R)$ is a division ring

fields.name: semilocal
fields.definition: $R/J(R)$ is Artinian

fields.name: semiperfect
fields.definition: $R$ is semilocal and lift/rad

fields.name: lift/rad
fields.definition: Idempotents of $R/J(R)$ lift to idempotents in R

fields.name: stable range 1
fields.definition: If $xa+b=1$, there is a $y$ such that $a+yb$ is a unit

fields.name: primary
fields.definition: $R$ semiprimary and $R/J(R)$ simple

fields.name: top simple
fields.definition: $R/J(R)$ simple

fields.name: top simple Artinian
fields.definition: $R/J(R)$ simple Artinian

fields.name: top regular
fields.definition: $R/J(R)$ von Neumann regular

fields.name: semicommutative  (SI condition, zero-insertive)
fields.definition: $ab=0$ implies $aRb=\{0\}$ for all $a,b\in R$.

fields.name: NI (nilpotents form an ideal)
fields.definition: The set of nilpotent elements in $R$ forms an ideal.

fields.name: 2-primal
fields.definition: All minimal prime ideals are completely prime

fields.name: reversible
fields.definition: ab=0 implies ba=0

fields.name: symmetric
fields.definition: $abc=0$ implies $acb=0$

fields.name: strongly connected
fields.definition: The only idempotents are 0 and 1

fields.name: connected
fields.definition: The only central idempotents are $0$ and $1$

fields.name: orthogonally finite
fields.definition: families of orthogonal idempotents are all finite

fields.name: Abelian
fields.definition: All idempotents are central

fields.name: Dedekind finite
fields.definition: xy=1 implies yx=1

fields.name: stably finite
fields.definition: Every matrix ring of $R$ is Dedekind finite

fields.name: finite
fields.definition: $R$ has only finitely many elements

fields.name: IBN
fields.definition: If $R^n$ is isomorphic to $R^m$, then $n=m$

fields.name: strongly $\pi$-regular
fields.definition: For all $x\in R$, $xR\supseteq x^2R\supseteq x^3R\supseteq \ldots$ terminates

fields.name: $\pi$-regular
fields.definition: For all $a$ in $R$ there exists an $x\in R$ and a natural number $n$ such that $(a^n)x(a^n)=a^n$

fields.name: exchange
fields.definition: If $a+b=1$, there exists $r$ and $s$ such that $ar$ and $bs$ are idempotents and $ar+bs=1$

fields.name: $I_0$
fields.definition: Every right ideal not contained in $J(R)$ contains a nonzero idempotent. Also called "semipotent".

fields.name: Zorn
fields.definition: $R$ is $I_0$ and $J(R)$ is a nil ideal

fields.name: semiregular
fields.definition: $R$ is lift/rad and $R/J(R)$ is von Neumann regular

fields.name: polynomial identity
fields.definition: There exists an element of $\mathbb Z\langle x_1,\ldots x_n\rangle$ for which any set of $n$ ring elements satisfies the polynomials

fields.name: clean
fields.definition: Every element is the sum of a unit and an idempotent

fields.name: weakly clean
fields.definition: For all $a\in R$, there exists a unit $u$ and idempotent $e$ such that $a-e-u\in (1-e)Ra$. This is left-right symmetric.

fields.name: field
fields.definition: A commutative division ring

fields.name: algebraically closed field
fields.definition: Every nonconstant polynomial over the field has a root in the field

fields.name: Euclidean field
fields.definition: An ordered field for which every positive element is the square of another element

fields.name: quadratically closed field
fields.definition: Every element is a square of another element

fields.name: ordered field
fields.definition: the field is totally ordered with an order compatible with the ring operations

fields.name: Pythagorean field
fields.definition: The sum of two squares is a square

fields.name: characteristic 0 field
fields.definition: The sum of any positive number of 1's is always nonzero.

fields.name: perfect field
fields.definition: A field over which every irreducible polynomial has distinct roots.

fields.name: Archimedean field
fields.definition: an ordered field such that for every $x$ there exists an integer $n>x$.

fields.name: Artinian
fields.definition: Descending chain condition on right ideals

fields.name: Noetherian
fields.definition: Ascending chain condition on right ideals

fields.name: principal ideal domain
fields.definition: Domain which is a principal right ideal ring

fields.name: principal ideal ring
fields.definition: All right ideals are cyclic

fields.name: Bezout
fields.definition: Finitely generated right ideals are cyclic

fields.name: Bezout domain
fields.definition: Right Bezout domain

fields.name: Ore domain
fields.definition: Domain satisfying right Ore condition

fields.name: hereditary
fields.definition: All right ideals are projective

fields.name: semihereditary
fields.definition: All finitely generated right ideals are projective

fields.name: Rickart
fields.definition: For any x in R, the right annihilator of x is a summand of R

fields.name: nonsingular
fields.definition: The right singular ideal is zero

fields.name: primitive
fields.definition: There exists a faithful simple right $R$ module

fields.name: V ring
fields.definition: The Jacobson radical of every right module is zero

fields.name: valuation ring
fields.definition: The right ideals of $R$ are linearly ordered

fields.name: serial
fields.definition: $R$ is a direct sum of right ideals whose submodules are linearly ordered

fields.name: pseudo-Frobenius
fields.definition: $R$ is right self-injective and finitely cogenerated as a right module

fields.name: finitely pseudo-Frobenius
fields.definition: Every finitely generated faithful right module is a generator for the category of $R$ modules

fields.name: self-injective
fields.definition: $R$ is injective as a right module

fields.name: Kasch
fields.definition: Every simple right module is isomorphic to a minimal right ideal of $R$

fields.name: perfect
fields.definition: $R$ is semilocal and $J(R)$ is right T-nilpotent

fields.name: cohopfian
fields.definition: For every $x$ with right annihilator zero, $x$ is a unit

fields.name: duo
fields.definition: All right ideals are two-sided ideals

fields.name: finite uniform dimension
fields.definition: $R$ has finite uniform dimension as a right $R$ module

fields.name: Goldie
fields.definition: $R$ has finite right uniform dimension and  ACC on right annihilators

fields.name: coherent
fields.definition: Every finitely generated right ideal is finitely presented

fields.name: ACC principal
fields.definition: Ascending chain condition on principal right ideals

fields.name: ACC annihilator
fields.definition: Ascending chain condition on right annihilators=Descending chain condition on left annihilators

fields.name: DCC annihilator
fields.definition: Descending chain condition on right annihilators=Ascending chain condition on left annihilators

fields.name: dual
fields.definition: For every right ideal $B$, $r.ann(l.ann(B))=B$

fields.name: continuous
fields.definition: $R$ is right CS, and any right ideal isomorphic to a direct summand of $R$ is itself a summand.

fields.name: free ideal ring
fields.definition: All right ideals are free modules and of unique rank

fields.name: Ore ring
fields.definition: Satisfies right Ore conditions

fields.name: principally injective
fields.definition: homomorphisms from principal right ideals of the ring into the ring extend to endomorphisms of the ring

fields.name: quasi-duo
fields.definition: maximal right ideals are two-sided

fields.name: T-nilpotent radical
fields.definition: Has right T-nilpotent Jacobson radical

fields.name: simple socle
fields.definition: The right socle is a minimal right ideal

fields.name: finitely generated socle
fields.definition: Finitely generated right socle

fields.name: nonzero socle
fields.definition: Nonzero right socle

fields.name: essential socle
fields.definition: Essential right socle

fields.name: cogenerator ring
fields.definition: The ring cogenerates its category of right modules

fields.name: finitely cogenerated
fields.definition: The ring is finitely cogenerated as a right module

fields.name: distributive
fields.definition: Lattice of right ideals is a distributive lattice

fields.name: uniform
fields.definition: All nonzero right ideals essential

fields.name: Ikeda-Nakayama
fields.definition: The left annihilator of the intersection of two right ideals, is the sum of their left annihilators

fields.name: simple-injective
fields.definition: If $T$ is a right ideal of $R$, and $f:T\to R$ such that $f(T)$ is simple, then $f$ can be extended to $R\to R$

fields.name: FI-injective
fields.definition: If $T$ is a right ideal of $R$, and $f:T\to R$ such that f(T) is finitely generated, then $f$ can be extended to $R\to R$

fields.name: quasi-continuous
fields.definition: $R$ is right CS, and if $e,f$ are idempotents with $eR\cap fR=\{0\}$, then $eR\oplus fR$ is a summand of $R$.

fields.name: CS
fields.definition: Every nonzero right ideal is essential in a direct summand of $R_R$.

fields.name: Dedekind domain
fields.definition: A domain whose ideals are projective modules

fields.name: Prufer domain
fields.definition: A domain whose finitely generated ideals are projective modules

fields.name: Euclidean domain
fields.definition: A domain which has a Euclidean valuation

fields.name: unique factorization domain
fields.definition: A domain in which every nonzero nonunit is a product of irreducible elements, unique up to equivalence

fields.name: regular local
fields.definition: Noetherian local ring where the minimal number of generators for the maximal ideal is equal to its Krull dimension

fields.name: regular
fields.definition: Noetherian ring whose localizations at primes are regular local rings

fields.name: Cohen-Macaulay
fields.definition: Ring whose localizations at primes all have depth equal to their Krull dimension

fields.name: normal
fields.definition: Ring whose localizations at primes all are normal domains

fields.name: analytically normal
fields.definition: a local ring whose completion is a normal ring

fields.name: analytically unramified
fields.definition: a local ring whose completion is reduced

fields.name: Gorenstein
fields.definition: Ring whose localizations at primes all are Noetherian and have finite injective dimension

fields.name: Mori domain
fields.definition: A domain satisfying the ACC on divisorial ideals

fields.name: GCD domain
fields.definition: A domain having a gcd for every pair of elements

fields.name: atomic domain
fields.definition: A domain in which nonzero nonunits can be written as a finite product of irreducible elements.

fields.name: Jacobson (Hilbert)
fields.definition: Prime ideals are intersections of maximal ideals

fields.name: Schreier domain
fields.definition: normal domain in which every element is primal

fields.name: normal domain
fields.definition: domain that is integrally closed in its field of fractions

fields.name: rad-nil
fields.definition: $Nil(R)=J(R)$

fields.name: local complete intersection
fields.definition: Noetherian local ring whose completion is the quotient of a regular local ring by an ideal generated by a regular sequence

fields.name: Krull domain
fields.definition: localizations at height 1 primes are all discrete valuation rings

fields.name: universally catenary
fields.definition: All finitely generated algebras over $R$ are catenary

fields.name: Grothendieck
fields.definition: Noetherian and its formal fibers are geometrically regular

fields.name: J-2
fields.definition: for every finitely generated $R$-algebra $S$, the singular points of $Spec(S)$ form a closed subset.

fields.name: quasi-excellent
fields.definition: $R$ is Grothendieck and J-2

fields.name: excellent
fields.definition: $R$ is quasi-excellent and universally catenary

fields.name: N-1
fields.definition: A domain $R$ whose integral closure in its quotient field is a finitely generated $R$ module.

fields.name: Japanese (N-2)
fields.definition: A domain $R$ such that for every finite extension $L$ of its quotient field $K$, the integral closure of $R$ in $L$ is a finitely generated A-module

fields.name: universally Japanese
fields.definition: every finitely generated integral domain over $R$ is Japanese

fields.name: Nagata
fields.definition: Noetherian and universally Japanese

fields.name: J-1
fields.definition: the set of regular points of the spectrum is an open subset

fields.name: J-0
fields.definition: the set of regular points of the spectrum contains a non-empty open subset

fields.name: complete local
fields.definition: $R$ is a local ring in which the canonical map into the completion at the maximal ideal is an isomorphism.
